before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"397lc","text":"Pre-combust 12 ml amber vials (one for each sample/sample blank/standard/standard blank) and glass vials (for MilliQ water, concentrated sulphuric acid, acid-dichromate reagent).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5vjrn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"frobc","text":"Rinse vial caps with 95% ethanol and dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c7nsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"gnd8","text":"Rinse serological pipet (0.5 and 5 mL) with chloroform. The pipets are used to measure and transfer extract,  concentrated sulphuric acid and acid-dichromate reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ea5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"t96c","text":"Rinse syringe with chloroform and dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4jum4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"egfma","text":"This is a protocol for quantitating total lipids in microalgae. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3r0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32vhv","text":"The acid-dichromate method is widely used to perform colorimetric analysis of extracted lipids. Here we present a protocol using 96-well microtiter plate for safe and efficient sample handling with high throughput. Only 500 ul of 0.15% acid-dichromate is required for each sample, which greatly reduces the amount of corrosive and toxic reagent.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkc4b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n9rf","text":"In addition, comparing with the absorbance at 440 nm, the absorbance at 348 nm yields five-time higher sensitivity in lipids quantitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39mih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dhqa","text":"Total lipids in the samples should not excess 100 ug. Accurate quantitation can be achieved with as little as 20 ug. A working detection limit is about 5 ug. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnaee","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ksg3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Pand SV, ParvinKhan R, Venkitasubramanian TA.","can_edit":1,"date":null,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1016/0003-2697(63)90094-0","guid":"A9871540484F11EAB63B6977DC103E2B","id":223,"journal":"Analytical Biochemistry.","title":"Microdetermination of lipids and serum total fatty acids."}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5efp","text":"Lipids of microalgae is extracted by Folch solvent. references.title: Microdetermination of lipids and serum total fatty acids.
references.authors: Pand SV, ParvinKhan R, Venkitasubramanian TA.

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"70lf9","text":"Prepare  glyceryl tripalmitate (GTP) primary standard solution (around 1 mg/ml)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e4sqf","text":"Place frozen GTP in vacuum desiccator with lose cap until it is warmed to    before making primary standard solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3vst9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7C234050485011EAB63B6977DC103E2B","id":"50014","label":"","temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"edcef","text":"Weigh around   GTP, take note of the actual weight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ahjii","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"924AF170485011EAB63B6977DC103E2B","id":"90298","label":"","unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pgqj","text":"Dissolve GTP by   chloroform in amber vial, gently vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4d3io","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"FD9AB080484811EAB63B6977DC103E2B","id":"90299","label":"","unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rb5b","text":"5 ug/vial:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c38dd","text":"In two 12 ml amber vials, add   GTP primary standard to each vial. {"blocks":[{"key":"epoaq","text":"Use 5 ml serological pipet to measure and transfer concentrated sulphuric acid to this vial. Write down the weight of sulphuric acid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":167,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dusb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"83ECAB80E68411ECA4C891B75063366C","id":0,"step_guid":"F5363BD5867D42C5BBF9758DDC1E6183","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3te4","text":"The weight of dichromate required for the 0.15% (w/w) acid-dichromate reagent equals the weight of sulphuric acid multiplied by (0.15/99.85).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0o2e","text":"Weigh dichromate and dissolve it into concentrated sulphuric acid. Cap the vial and vortex gently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8v8b5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8h1um","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50cl5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2o9dl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":4}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d6e3e","text":"      ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"D4A8E190E68111ECA4C891B75063366C","height":425,"id":251886,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hx9s8uue.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hx9q8uue.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hx9r8uue.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hx9p8uue.webp","width":544},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2pb83","text":"The high limit of detection is 100 ug. Higher concentration from 150 ug to 300 ug shows different linear response, which should be avoided.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"drkik","text":"Subtract absorbance of \"+Blank\" from the absorbance of samples and sample blanks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ai74t","text":"Calculate the mass of lipids by using the standard curve and the resulted absorbance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6snee","text":"Subtract the lipids mass of the blank filter from the lipids mass of the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16nlk","text":"Convert the resulted mass to total extracted lipids based on the fraction of extract used in the reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
